title: Louise Ellman on why she quit Labour: I was accused of having dual loyalty to Israel
text:
Dame Louise Ellman knew that relations in her local party had reached a particularly nasty ebb when a group of new hard-Left activists refused to use her name because of her support for Israel. They referred to her only as “the MP”, throwing around the word “Zionist’ as a term of abuse, and one member shouted “No, no, no” when she suggested they call her Louise.

That meeting was one of many that led the 73-year-old Jewish MP to quit the Labour Party last week, after 55 years as a member. She wrote in her resignation statement that Labour is “no longer a safe place for Jews” under Jeremy Corbyn, who she said “spent three decades on the backbenches consorting with, and never confronting, antisemites,...
